title: Jerry Garcia
summary: Jerome John Garcia (August 1, 1942 – August 9, 1995)[1][2][3][4] was an American guitarist, singer and songwriter, best known for being a principal songwriter, the lead guitarist and a vocalist with the rock band the Grateful Dead, of which he was a founding member and which came to prominence during the counterculture of the 1960s.[5][6] Although he disavowed the role, Garcia was viewed by many as the leader of the band.[7][8][9]
